fields.summary: Fix add on validation for macro parameter types.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

During the custom PDF export of a space, because the Request includes the content ID of every page regardless of if it is selected or not, it overruns the available space for the field it is later stored in and the export fails to ever run.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a space with around 4000 pages in it (about 3600 is probably near the lower bound)
 # Attempt a PDF "custom" export. (the selection is irrelevant. Selecting one or all the pages will still cause the issue)
 # Start the export.

h3. Expected Results
 - The export starts (and ideally finishes) normally.
h3. Actual Results

The Export does not start instead giving a 500 error with this content on the page:
{noformat}
Oops - an error has occurred
System Error
A system error has occurred — our apologies!

For immediate troubleshooting, consult our knowledge base for a solution.

If you would like to receive support from Atlassian's support team, ask your Confluence administrator to create a support issue on Atlassian's support system with the following information:

a description of your problem and what you were doing at the time it occurred
a copy of the error and system information found below
a copy of the application logs (if possible).
Your Confluence administrator can use the support request form to create a support ticket which will include this information.

We will respond as promptly as possible.
Thank you!

Return to site homepage…
{noformat}
You can also see the following error when trying to make a custom export:
{code}
Already running this task.
{code}

The below exception is thrown in the logs:
{noformat}
rg.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: Hibernate operation: could not execute statement; ERROR: value too long for type character varying(32768); nested exception is org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: value too long for type character varying(32768)
org.springframework.jdbc.support.SQLStateSQLExceptionTranslator.doTranslate(SQLStateSQLExceptionTranslator.java:104)
org.springframework.jdbc.support.AbstractFallbackSQLExceptionTranslator.translate(AbstractFallbackSQLExceptionTranslator.java:72)
org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTransactionManager.convertJdbcAccessException(HibernateTransactionManager.java:619)
org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTransactionManager.convertHibernateAccessException(HibernateTransactionManager.java:605)
org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTransactionManager.doCommit(HibernateTransactionManager.java:518)
com.atlassian.confluence.impl.hibernate.ConfluenceHibernateTransactionManager.doCommit(ConfluenceHibernateTransactionManager.java:58)
org.springframework.transaction.support.AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.processCommit(AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.java:746)
org.springframework.transaction.support.AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.commit(AbstractPlatformTransactionManager.java:714)
sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor86.invoke(Unknown Source)
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:343)
org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:205)
com.sun.proxy.$Proxy70.commit(Unknown Source)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently, the best workaround is to move the pages that you want to export into a new space, being sure to keep the number of pages in the space around 2000 or below.
fields.summary: Custom export fails with 500 if there are too many pages.

fields.description:
We have a need to populate a duration of multiple days in the Team calendar.  Ideally we accomplish this by creating a Jira filter and auto-populating the calendar.  Which is fine that works.  However, there is no way to choose more than one day.

I envision a way to indicate there is a start and end date.  Then define that start and end date based on fields in Jira. 

So if I create an issue and there are two dates on the issue 1-out of office start date and 2-out of office end date.  Those get populated.  I create a filter to pull in those tickets.  I go to the Team Calendar and choose the Jira Filter.  Then there be a way to ask if there are multiple day duration and then let me pick my start date based on a date/time field (which I would choose the date/time field out of office start date) and end date based on a date/time field (which would be out of office end date). 

Hopefully my suggestion is clear.  Please contact me if clarity is needed/wanted.
fields.summary: Ability to define Start and End duration based on two dates from a Jira Filters to populate Team Calendars

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Rest API calls are not returning blog posts when the user is not authenticated.

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set global permissions to allow anonymous access
 # Allow anonymous access on a space
 # Run *rest/api/space/<SPACE KEY>/content* 
or *rest/api/search?cql=type%3Dblogpost%20order%20by%20created%20desc&limit=5&expand=content.version,content.body.export_view,content.history&excerpt=highlight&privacyMode=true*
** User shouldn't be authenticated

The issue is also reproducible  while accessing the blog posts section on UI, the page  tree  won't be loaded.

h3. Expected Results
If the  blog posts are accessible anonymously, they should be returned by the API

h3. Actual Results
The API calls are not returning blog posts, only pages can be found.

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: API call is not returning blog posts when user is not authenticated

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When choosing to show individual and cumulative results, it only shows individual results even selecting to show cumulative results.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert 'Created vs Resolved Chart' macro
# Choose to set the *Cumulative Totals: No*
# Save the configuration
# Edit the page and set the *Cumulative Totals: Yes*
# Save the configuration

h3. Expected Results
When choosing to show cumulative results, it should show the cumulative values of the report.

h3. Actual Results
When choosing to show cumulative results, it's still showing individual results

h3. Workaround
- None
fields.summary: Created vs Resolved chart macro not working to show cumulative results

fields.description:
h3. Summary
- Using Recently Updated macro and restricting a specific set of labels, page comment update is not shown. 

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert Recently Updated macro
# Restrict by label

h3. Expected Results
Restricting labels in the Recently Updated macro should work for page comment update. 

h3. Actual Results
Restricting labels in the Recently Updated macro does not work restrict page comment

h3. Workaround
- None
fields.summary: Restricting labels in the Recently Updated macro does not work restrict page comment

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access Confluence using Chrome
# In Japanese [IME|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Input_method], type "kyouto" and select "京都" from the suggested list

h3. Expected Results
"京都" gets confirmed and the focus stays there waiting for further input

h3. Actual Results
"京都" gets confirmed and the search is triggered
 
h3. Notes
* This happens in macOS 10.14.6 using Chrome

h3. Workaround
* Try using Firefox or Safari
* Try using the Confluence standard search
fields.summary: When using IME, quick search is triggered upon the Enter key to confirm the character

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new editor page with a link in it, publish
 # Select the link text
 # When "Add a Comment" pops up over your selection
 # Type a comment and hit "Save"

h3. Expected Results

You should be prevented from leaving an inline comment, and it should instead force it to be a general comment.

This is how it is for Tiny because the behavior of an inline comment conflicts with the behavior of a link (they both rely on a click).
h3. Actual Results

Page is completely broken, you can no longer view or edit the page, instead you get a nasty error message.

h3. Notes
Older pages, that contained links in the middle of inline comments might present issues when migrating to the new editor.

h3. Workaround

Only workaround is to restore the page to a previous version where it wasn't broken if one exists.
fields.summary: Adding an inline comment on a link in a Fabric page can break the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users are unable to insert the PDF Macro referencing PDF Documents attached on other pages

h3. Environment
Cloud - Tested with both New and Old Editors

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Page, Upload a PDF, and Publish the Page
# Create a New Page and insert the PDF Macro
# Input the Page Name from 1 and select the PDF File from the dropdown

h3. Expected Results
PDF can be previewed and the Macro can be inserted

h3. Actual Results
No Preview loads and macro cannot be inserted

Error generated in Browser Console Logs when trying to insert the Macro:
{code}overrides.js:74 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'getCurrentTitle' of undefined
    at e.beforeParamsRetrieved (overrides.js:74)
    at Object.q [as getMacroDefinitionFromForm] (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-macro-browser:macro-browser-js.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:74)
    at Object.a.complete (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-macro-browser:macro-browser-js.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:135)
    at HTMLButtonElement.<anonymous> (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-macro-browser:macro-browser-js.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:116)
    at HTMLButtonElement._onclick (batch.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:792)
    at HTMLButtonElement.dispatch (jquery-min.js:1)
    at HTMLButtonElement.a (jquery-min.js:1){code}

h3. Notes
The PDF Macro will insert correctly if the PDF referenced is Local to the Page.

Inserting the PDF on the New Page could work, however, this is not ideal as it would require the User to maintain the PDF across multiple pages rather than in a single spot if using the PDF Macro

h3. Workaround
- The [Attachments macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/attachments-macro-724765160.html] could be used to reference the PDFs on the other Page, however, the User will need to download the file to view it - Bug with Previewing in the Attachments Macro - https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40609
-- Labels and Filename Pattern could be utilized to display only PDFs and specific ones if the reference page contains multiple different attachments.
fields.summary: Unable to Insert PDFs from Other Pages Using the PDF Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When accessing a public space as anonymous, the page tree will fail to load in case user has a Portal account.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a portal customer account
 # access a space with anonymous permission and then try to open any page on it.
Basically, if you are logged in as a Service Desk Customer you can reproduce the problem.

h3. Expected Results
The space should load correctly
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
The page tree doesn't load, with the following errors:
{quote}Page tree failed to load{quote}
{quote}Something went wrong.
Refresh the page and try again. If this keeps happening, let us know using the link below.{quote}

h3. Workaround
Logout of your atlassian account or try to open the page in Incognito/Private Mode from your browser.
fields.summary: Space failed to load for Portal Customers accounts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to select a word in the collaborative editing, it is not possible to select the whole word, only a part of it, when the text cursor of the other editor in the page is on it.
h3. Environment

Fabric Editor.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a page with another user in the same page
 # Try to select a word where the other user text cursor is on with a double click

h3. Expected Results

The word should be selected with the double click.
h3. Actual Results

The word is selected only until to the point where the text cursor of the other user editing the page is on, not being selected entirely.
h3. Workaround

Drag and copy the text.
fields.summary: Selecting the text with a double click is not possible in collaborative editing

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users are unable to edit office files externally when previewing them in the new editor. In preview mode the user would not have the *Edit With* option, provided by Atlassian Companion, and will only allow the file to be downloaded.

h3. Environment
* New Editor
* Atlassian Companion

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page using the new editor;
# Insert an office file into the page (i.e. a .xlsx spreadsheet);
# Publish the page, and click the recently inserted file;

h3. Expected Results
* User should be able to have the option to click *Edit With* and open the file on an external application, via Atlassian Companion, when previewing the file;
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-01 at 14.12.51.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* User is only able to either *Download* or *Close* the file preview, and no option to open the file externally.
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-01 at 14.10.59.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Notes
* You can test this behavior with this file:  [^Atlassian Test - Excel.xlsx] 

h3. Workaround

# Open page
# Go to "Attachments" list (using the *...* button -> Attachments)
# Find your attachment and click *View*
# In preview mode you'll be able to edit the file by clicking *Edit With*.
fields.summary: Unable to edit office files in the new editor with Atlassian Companion

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Confluence Questions should have necessary Space permission under add-on permission so that users can Accept answers. However, the error is too generic that the user doesn't have any idea why Accepting answer is not possible. 

{code}
Accept answer didn't work
We're not sure what caused the problem. Check your internet connection and try again. 
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a helpful error when Confluence Questions doesn't have required permission to Accept an answer
fields.summary: Provide a helpful error when Confluence Questions doesn't have required permission to Accept an answer

fields.description:
h3. +Issue Summary+

If you have a space with spacekey=*TestV*(say), and you want to change the key to *TestV1.2*(say) before importing it to any other instance. You can make these changes in the entities.xml and exportDescriptor.properties files but after the import, you will see all the pages broken.

h3. +Environment+
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. +Steps to Reproduce+
 # Export any Confluence space, say space with spacekey *TestV*
 # Download and unzip the space backup and modify the entities.xml and exportDescriptor.properties files like below:

In *entities.xml* we have to modify the *spacekey* and *lowerKey*:
 {code} <property name="name"><![CDATA[TestV]]></property>
  <property name="key"><![CDATA[TestV1.2]]></property>
  <property name="lowerKey"><![CDATA[testv1.2]]></property>{code}

In *exportDescriptor.properties* we have to modify the spaceKey:
 {code} spaceKey=TestV1.2{code}

h3. +Expected Results+
Space should get imported as normal and content should be as it was there in the source instance.

h3. +Actual Results+
Space gets imported but all the pages are broken with below error:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. +Notes+
Space can have a decimal in the name, the issue is when the spacekey is forced to have decimal(.)
Here is the space for replicating the behavior: https://sfali6885.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TestV1.2/overview
It used to have spacekey *TestV*, I changed it to *TestV1.2* and imported it to find broken pages.

h3. +Workaround+
Currently, there is no workaround but it will be added here once available.
fields.summary: Spaces should be allowed to have spacekey with special characters like decimal(.)

fields.description:
In the old editor, we had the *preformatted* format as an option to change the text style.

On the new editing experience, this feature has changed to the *Code* format. However, when using this formatting it adds a grey background in the text that is not continuous - when we add a new line, it let a blank space between the grey backgrounds, which makes the page layout not so desired.

!image-2019-10-01-09-34-51-971.png|width=404,height=317!

This feature aims to add an option to remove this grey background, so we can use both ways.
fields.summary: Add an option to remove grey background from Code text format

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * Previously, when a new user is added, the Profile Default Language will be set to *Automatically detect browser setting*
 ** https://<domain>.atlassian.net/wiki/users/editmysettings.action
 * Now, when a new user is added, the Profile Default Language will be set to *English (US)* and doesn't respect the Global Default Language set.
 ** https://<domain>.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/viewlanguage.action
 * It seems that all users who used *Automatically detect browser setting* on their profile was automatically changed to *English (US)*

h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure that your browser language is set to English (UK)
 # Create a new instance and set the General Default Language to English (UK)
 # Add a new user, the user's browser language is set to English (UK)
 # Ask the new user to check his/her Profile Default Language

h3. Expected Results

Previously, when a new user is added, the Profile Default Language will be set to *Automatically detect browser setting*
 - https://<domain>.atlassian.net/wiki/users/editmysettings.action

h3. Actual Results

When a new user is added, the Profile Default Language will be set to *English (US)* and doesn't respect the Global Default Language set.
 - https://<domain>.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/viewlanguage.action

It seems that all users who used *Automatically detect browser setting* on their profile was automatically changed to *English (US)*
h3. Workaround

Manually change the Profile Default language to the desired Language
fields.summary: Default Language setting in user profile is automatically set to English (US)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to edit/ add a comment to a Confluence page that has the *Content by Label*, it will: 
* open the editor, but, will only keep loading with a spinning icon, instead of displaying the content. 
* Open the comment dialog but the user won't be able to type the comment.

This seems to be affecting specific instances and environments.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Insert the *Content by Label* on it and set it to get results from some labels;
# Publish the page and access a different page (or, manually reload the page and clear the browser cache);
# Publish the page again and then, try to edit the same or comment on it

h3. Expected Results
* The editor should open, allowing the user to edit the page.
* It should be possible to add comments to the page

h3. Actual Results
* The editor keeps loading
* It's not possible to add comments on view mode

h3. Workaround
# Refresh the editor and the editor will be loaded.
# Remove the Content by Label macro from the page.
fields.summary: Content by Label on a page causes problems to edit and comment the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Spaces Homepages are created in Trash

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a space from a template (Documentation, Teams, etc)

h3. Expected Results
Space is created and you're able to use it.
All pages are working as expected.
No errors are shown.

h3. Actual Results
Space is created, however an exception is displayed in the screen.
The exception reads:

{quote}
*We can't create that blueprint right now.*
Hibernate operation: could not execute statement; sql=n/a; SQL []; ERROR: update or delete on table "content" violates foreign key constraint "fkwjyn6091q3l1gl7bh143ma2a" on table "content" Detail: Key (contentid)=(508461219) is still referenced from table "content".; nested exception is org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: update or delete on table "content" violates foreign key constraint "fkwjyn6091q3l1gl7bh143ma2a" on table "content" Detail: Key (contentid)=(508461219) is still referenced from table "content"
{quote}

h3. Notes

If you take a look at the space's *Trash*, you'll be able to see the homepage there, which has the same contentID referenced in the exception.

This is an intermittent issue and doesn't seem to affect all Confluence Cloud sites.

h3. Workaround
Navigate to *Trash* and restore the space's home page.
fields.summary: Spaces Homepages are created in Trash

N/A

fields.description:
{panel:title=UPDATE 21 DECEMBER 2020}
Hi all! My name is Jonno and I’m a PM on the Atlassian Cloud Editor in Confluence Cloud. Thanks for your feedback.

*Confirming the problem*

To firstly make sure I’m on the same page, the problem as I see it being discussed is that:
 * You want to share docs on Confluence with external customers or stakeholders to your company.

 * The Smart Links that automatically render, require authentication, even if a Confluence page is public. Therefore, external readers can’t see the title of the link and just see an unresolved state of the Smart Link with a URL and a message to connect your account.

 * To work around this, you’re currently required to update the formatting of all the links to be plain text hyperlinks.

Can you please confirm this accurately captures the problem? If not, can you please provide more details.

*Why the current state?*

To give some context about the current state, we require authentication, because we do our best to respect the permissions of the links referenced on a page. Thus, the meta-data associated with the link can’t be retrieved without knowing who the page consumer/reader is. We want to avoid a situation where someone with access to a page that’s public can see the content of a different page, Jira issue, Google Drive file, etc, that’s intentionally been made private.

That said, we know that we don’t currently support automatically resolving the meta-data of a Smart Link that’s on a page, even if the link itself is public. We’re keen to dig into this problem, and are hoping you can help shed some light on your needs and use cases with us. Please see the next section and its associated questions.

In the meantime, if you want to opt out of the Smart Links experience, we’ve recently added the ability to easily change a Smart Link to a normal URL. To do so, simply select a Smart Link → select the view switcher in the floating toolbar → select the Display URL option in the dropdown.

!image-2020-12-21-15-39-39-503.png|width=276,height=159!

*Help we need from you to better understand how we could progress this*

To help understand your exact problems, could you please clarify the following questions:
 # Are the links you’re trying to share just other Confluence links? Or are they also links to other products (e.g. Google Drive and Jira issues)?

 # Are the links you’re trying to share on the page, also public?

We’d love to have a chat to better understand your needs. If you’re interested, you can book in a time to have a 1:1 conversation with me here - [https://calendly.com/jkatahanas/atlassian-cloud-editor-anon-user-smart-link]

Thanks again for the feedback. I’m moving this ticket to “Gathering Impact”. Looking into this more, we need more context before we can decide on the best path forward.

Cheers,

Jonno | PM, Atlassian Cloud Editor
{panel}
h3. 

Summary
 - If you insert a link to a page in Confluence, the URL of the page will automatically create the link. The title of the page will be the text that will be displayed.

 - This works for logged in users. However, for Anonymous user, they can see the URL of the page instead of the Page Title with the link.

h3. Environment

Fabric Editor
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Page 1
 # Create Page 2 and insert a link to Page 1
 # Logged in user to access Page 2
 # Enable Anonymous Access to the site and space
 # Anonymous user to access Page 2

h3. Expected Results
 - Link Object Resolver should also work for Anonymous User.

h3. Actual Results
 - Anonymous users can see the URL of the page instead of the Page Title with the link.
 - An internal link (ac:link) automatically becomes an external link (href) when display text is added.

h3. Workaround
 - Add "Text to Display" on the link.
fields.summary: Link Object Resolver doesn't work for Anonymous users

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of July 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Microsoft has not released any major updates for IE11 since 2015, and has [recently discouraged the use of IE11 as a default browser|https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/Windows-IT-Pro-Blog/The-perils-of-using-Internet-Explorer-as-your-default-browser/ba-p/331732].

To allow us to continue to take advantage of modern web standards to deliver improved functionality and the best possible user experience across all of our products, we have ended support for IE11 on *31 March 2020*.

End of support means we will not fix bugs that are specific to IE11, and will begin to introduce features that aren't compatible with this browser.

Find out more about this change from our [announcement|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Feedback-Forum-articles/Retiring-IE11-support-for-Atlassian-cloud-server-and-data-center/ba-p/1185312].

If you have questions or concerns about this change, please comment on this issue.
{panel}
fields.summary: Plans to end support for IE11

fields.description:
{panel:title= Bug Fix Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
 You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

The exact match doesn't work with the new advanced search experience for CJK text.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 3 pages which have a title {{消費税}}, {{消去}} and {{増税対応}} accordingly.
 # Go to the old experience and search pages with a query {{"消費税"}} with double quotations.
 # Check the search result only contains the page which title is {{消費税}} as expected.
 ** !old-experience-exact-match.png|thumbnail!
 # Go to the new experience and search pages with the same query
 # Verify the search result contains the pages which title is {{消去}} and {{増税対応}} other than {{消費税}}.
 ** !advanced-search-unexpected-result.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The advanced search should extract the pages where the exact-match pattern is applied.
h3. Actual Results

The new advanced search returns irrelevant results for the exact match.
h3. Note

* Changing the indexing language doesn't help.
* Other [Operators|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-search-syntax-158720.html] also don't work such as {{-消費税}} but it also occurs to English search
 
h3. Workaround

Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.

Until then, try the exact-match search with the old experience.
fields.summary: New advanced search returns irrelevant results for the exact match

h3. Issue Summary
When using the [Task report macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-task-report-macro/], the sorting by *assignee* option will not work. Instead of re-ordering the tasks by the assignee names, nothing will happen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(i) Make sure to have tasks/action items already assigned to existing users prior to reproducing the issue.

# Create/edit a page and add the [Task report macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-task-report-macro/] to it.
# Publish the page.
# While viewing the page, tap the *Assignee* field of the macro.

h3. Expected Results
The order should change based on the *Assignee* sorting.

h3. Actual Results
The order will not change when tapping the *Assignee* option.

h3. Notes
* It only affects the *Assignee* parameter.
* Even when configuring the macro to sort by *Assignee* (prior to adding it to the page), the sorting will not be respected.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Issue Summary

The first page should be rendered inside the second page without change

It changes the layout of some of the contents

The changes also include:
 * Page include automatically adds a school bar that cuts off part of the page unless you scroll left to right.

fields.description:
Dear Confluence Cloud Team,

On behalf of the TechUp team I am reaching out to you asking for a collaboration request with your team around one of our Confluence apps Smart Tables currently on the Marketplace.
We believe that by building flawless and user-friendly experiences, we provide our customers the means to increase their teams' efficiency and engagement towards the Atlassian tools.

*Why Smart tables?*
Confluence users are eager to leverage native Confluence page editor's capabilities in order to perform their day to day tasks. Thus, building out tables in a few clicks by enriching the native confluence table using powerful operations and functions in the page editor experience is the main use case we addressed thanks to Smart tables.
As opposed to the other app's design and data scheme, we decided to lay the emphasis on a "Confluence page editor" experience avoiding the use of macros, or importing an excel sheet in Confluence bringing therefore to the end-user the closest experience to the native confluence comfort level they are used to and more importantly an outstanding User experience by reducing the number of possible clicks to achieve their goal.
Smart tables has today more that 700 active instances on server in less of two years from the product launch and our customers shared the same feedbacks: "ease of use" , "user friendliness"....

[check here|[https://marketplace-cdn.atlassian.com/files/images/aaa9eafa-3d02-4b8d-af27-96c8c580664c.png]]

 

*New confluence editing experience:*
As a Marketplace vendor and fans of Atlassian toolset we totally support the company's growth shift to cloud-based services and products and are working towards this common objective.

The new editor of confluence pages, currently available in the Atlassian cloud relies on a React implementation of ProseMirror (the @atlaskit/editor). This new implementation does not allow us to interact with the editor instance in order for example to modify the content of cell when is formula is set.
That is a probably is a React / Component pattern which forces the state of the Editor component to be managed by the internal renderer. That is why, we would hope that you guys expose an Access point / bridge allowing extensions to be made on the new editor.

We are available to go through the technical details together maybe through a conference or any other format that is convenient for you.
We are looking forward to working together in order to support our customers with the new editor experience in the Atlassian cloud.

Cheers,
fields.summary: Table editor collaboration request

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Feature requested by vendor in Developer Support https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/DEVHELP-3396.

It would be great to have this same feature feature from server:

{quote}
Currently in the server app, to implement the dynamic attachments dropdown list based on the chosen page we will be using below API and including in web resources.

AJS.MacroBrowser.activateSmartFieldsAttachmentsOnPage(“macro-name”, [“txt”,“text”]);
{quote}

 !Screenshot 2019-09-12 at 11.29.47 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3 Use Case
{quote}
Thanks for looking into it. The use case is, on the mentioned API invocation it will allow us to choose the page and attachments dynamically in the confluence macros. For example, see the attached screenshot.

The first macro parameter represents to choose the page and the second parameter to choose the attachment based on the page selected.
However, the automatic retrieval of the drop-down list for attachments would be automatically handled by the mentioned API invocation.

You can find some related docs and community questions below for a more detailed understanding.
https://bitbucket.org/resah/confluence-macro-tutorial/wiki/Home
https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Answers-Developer-Questions/How-can-I-set-attachment-parameter-to-confluence-macro/qaq-p/504510
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/11048149/confluence-macro-browser-autocompletion-for-attachments
{quote}

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently in the new editor for Confluence when an issue link from a linked JIRA is pasted it gets formatted and presents the issue status but it's not converted into a JIRA issue macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Confluence page on the new editor
# Paste a link from a JIRA issue inside the new page.
# Publish it.

h3. Expected Results

As per [Use Jira and Confluence together|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/use-jira-and-confluence-together-724765436.html] the link should be automatically converted into a JIRA issue Macro.

h3. Actual Results

The link is not converted and no links are created inside JIRA:
 !Screen Shot 2019-09-18 at 14.44.41.png|thumbnail! 

As the issues are simply links they won't count towards the overall JIRA counter that is displayed at the top of the page:
 !Screen Shot 2019-09-18 at 14.46.11.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround 

Convert the links into JIRA macros.
fields.summary: Pasted issue links in the new editor are not converted to JIRA macro

fields.description:
There are two scenarios that this request comes from:
 # I often create multiple tabs within a Lucidchart diagram to illustrate concepts around the same subject. I want to be able to reference a specific tab within the diagram, so that I don't have to create several individual diagrams for each concept I am explaining. 
 # When viewing a Lucidchart diagram on a wiki page, the tabs are only visible if you mouse over the chart - most of my colleagues miss this. It would be nice if the tabs always showed rather than hiding on mouse out. But, if I had a tab number to set it to, then I could at least get my readers to the right Lucidchart tab. 

 

Possible solution

The "Edit Lucidchart diagram" modal supports selecting Tab 1, 2, etc. This renders the Lucidchart doc with that tab selected.
fields.summary: Allow selection of tab when inserting a Lucidchart diagram into a wiki page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Images in TinyMCE pages that have had effects applied to them show as broken images.
h3. Environment
 * TinyMCE
 * Hello
 * Pug

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to hello or pug
 # View a page with an image that has image effects applied (such as 'drop-shadow')

h3. Expected Results
 * Image is viewable

h3. Actual Results
 * Image shows as broken

h3. Notes

 
h3. Workaround
 * Edit the page
 * Select the broken image
 * Remove the effect
 * Publish
fields.summary: Images with effects show as broken

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Applying an effect (such as drop-shadow) to an image causes the page to enter an infinite spinner state.
h3. Environment
 * TinyMCE editor
 * Reproduceable on Hello and Pug, but not on Simplify or out in the wild

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a TinyMCE page

 # Click on an image

 # Edit the image properties

 # Click “Drop Shadow”

 # Click “Save”

h3. Expected Results
 * Dialog goes away and drop-shadow effect applied

h3. Actual Results...
 * The dialog is caught in an infinite loop

h3. Notes
 * If you refresh the page, the dialog clears and the image appears to have disappeared.
 * If you then publish the page, the image will show as a broken image.
 * If you then edit the page again, select the broken image, and remove the effect then the image will show normally.

h3. Workaround
 * Refresh the page, the dialog clears and the image appears to have disappeared.
 * Publish the page, the image will show as a broken image.
 * Edit the page again, select the broken image, and remove the effect then the image will show normally.
fields.summary: Infinite spinner when effects added to an image

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When copying a single PowerPoint slide as an image and pasting it into a Confluence page, though it can be found in the page attachments session, it is not added in the page's body when we publish the page.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* Old Editing Experience
* Windows

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# From an opened PowerPoint file, right-click over a single slide in the sidebar and copy it;
# Paste the file into a Confluence page;
# Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
The .png file is being shown in the published version of the page.

h3. Actual Results
The .png file is not shown in the page's body - but it is attached to it when we go to the Attachments.

h3. Workaround
Use the *New Editing Experience*

OR

Take a screenshot from the slide with the own Windows Snipping Tool feature, or download a screenshot application from a third-party, like the *[Lightshot|https://app.prntscr.com/en/download.html ]*
fields.summary: Pasting single PowerPoint slide doesn't render on Confluence page

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 19 May 2020}
Hi all! My name’s Jonno and I’m the Product Manager that works on the Smart Link feature. Thanks a lot for your feedback. As we’re continuing to improve this feature, understanding use cases like all of yours is super important. From this thread, the three main asks are:  
 * Give admins more control around Smart Link behaviour
 * Give content creators more flexibility around how they do or don’t use Smart Links when inserting links
 * Give content consumers (i.e. those reading links) the ability to set preferences around Smart Link behaviour 

For all three areas, we don’t currently have short term plans but are actively investigating what we could do. We’ll keep this ticket updated as we know more.
  
 As as side note, for users who want to insert a simple URL instead of a Smart Link on insertion, there is an alternative approach you can take - simply paste a URL then click CMD + Z (macOS) or CTRL + Z (Windows) once it resolves. 
  
 Thanks again for your feedback. If anyone would like to talk directly to me about this feature and your needs, you can book a time to chat over Zoom here - [https://calendly.com/jkatahanas/editor]
  
 Cheers,
 Jonno Katahanas | Atlassian Product Manager
{panel}
h4. Summary

In Confluence Cloud New Editor, when inserting links from certain services (e.g. Box.com, Microsoft Onedrive, Dropbox, Google Drive, Invision, Trello, Bitbucket, Github, etc.) the link is automatically converted to a Smart Card link.

This occurs even when attempting to insert a link as a text link only.

For some of these services, a message, *{color:#0747a6}Connect your account to preview links{color}*, displays.
h4. Problem

Many users do not want to use the Smart Card behavior here or do not wish to connect their accounts. They simply want to insert a link to the resources.
h4. Solution
 # In the Link menu, provide the ability to disable Smart Card behavior for that link specifically, _*or*_
 # Provide a way to dismiss the *{color:#0747a6}Connect your account to preview links{color}* message besides connecting your account.

h4. Workaround

When inserting the link, be sure to use {{http://}} instead of {{https://}}. The Smart Card feature will not be activated, and upon visiting the URL, it will automatically redirect to {{https://}} for these services.

Alternatively, you can press Ctrl + Z (Windows) or Cmd + Z (macOS) (to revert the link to a normal blue link).
fields.summary: Ability to dismiss or disable Smart Card behavior for links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to use Insert Symbol/special characters in confluence pages. The macro dialog window is not responding.
h3. Environment

Confluence cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1.Create a page in confluence
 # Step 2.Go to "Insert content" (+) click on "Symbol"
 # Step 3. Insert symbol macro dialog window doesn’t appear.

Console error:
{code}
Uncaught Error: Theme did not provide a WindowManager implementation.
    at Object.e (atlassian-editor.min.js:2)
    at Object.open (atlassian-editor.min.js:2)
    at tw.<anonymous> (editor_plugin_src.js:14)
    at i.exec.(/wiki/spaces/TEST1/pages/edit/anonymous function) (https://confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/atlassian-editor~dc51bad7.88179405e3c1fc722989-v39.js:1:28749)
    at T.execCommand (atlassian-editor.min.js:1)
    at tw.execCommand (atlassian-editor.min.js:12)
    at tw.b [as execCommand] (batch.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:508)
    at adg3-plugin.js:160
    at HTMLLIElement.<anonymous> (adg3-plugin.js:441)
    at HTMLLIElement.dispatch (jquery-min.js:1)
{code}
h3. Expected Results

Insert symbol macro dialog window should appear.
h3. Actual Results

Insert symbol macro dialog window doesn’t appear.
h3. Workaround

Use Unicode:https://unicode-table.com/en/#latin-1-supplement, Find a character, press the ‘copy’ button shown in below screenshot then paste into your confluence page.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Insert symbol doesn't work anymore.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
- When inserting the "Jira roadmap" macro on a new page template and pressing cancel will cause a spinner that spins forever. You will then need to hard reload the entire page.

h3. Environment
- Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access Global Templates
#* https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/templates2/listglobaltemplates.action)
# Create a Template
# Insert A Jira Roadmap macro
# Press Cancel button

h3. Expected Results
- The template editor should load back after pressing the Cancel button

h3. Actual Results
- When inserting the "Jira roadmap" macro on a new page template and pressing cancel will cause a spinner that spins forever. You will then need to hard reload the entire page.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Inserting a Jira roadmap on page template causes a loading spinner forever
